What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.

Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course offered a good introduction to Italian grammar and culture.
I definitely feel I am better able to speak Italian. I also have a better understanding of Italian grammar and an expanded vocabulary.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: you actually become very proficient in Italian by the end of L4. The intense track was... intense, in a good way. 

Weaknesses: I took both summer sessions in a row and 10 weeks with no break was very exhausting

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend the course to any student who is interested in acquiring advanced Italian language skills, and also in learning about Italian culture with the regular class readings.

I would definitely recommend this course to anyone who wants to improve their ability to speak, read, and write in Italian. The course is interesting and challenging without being overwhelming. The professors are also very passionate about the language and really want to help you learn. The Italian department at Yale is consistently amazing and I highly recommend taking courses in the department whenever you can!
Yes - a really fun language and class!
